intro: Yeatesia viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered yeatesia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and vibrant greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Yeatesia viridiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
